lexUnit.name: expression.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the look on someone's face, seen as conveying a particular emotion.

sentence.text: She looked away , made uneasy by the threatening expression on his harsh features .

Everything within her wanted to fight him , but the forbidding expression on his harsh features , and the unmistakable threat in his voice , told her in no uncertain manner she 'd regret it if she did .
She smiled at Meredith 's surprised expression .
When she turned back again her expression made Mrs Files stand to reach her arm around Delia Sutherland 's shoulders .
Even as she was thinking about rallying her defences , his expression changed .
For long seconds , his expression serious , he looked down into her large green eyes , then , ` You 're trembling ! " he observed .
He wore a sombre , brooding expression that relaxed into a half-smile as he caught sight of her , sending a surge of electricity round her nervous system .
He was sitting at the table and staring ahead of him with a dark , brooding expression .
She had the same blank , anxious expression as some zoo animals have .
Abruptly , her face became devoid of expression .
His face was totally devoid of expression , but the intensity of his gaze told her his mind was working with the speed and emotionless precision of a computer .
Their faces took on a different expression ; they grew more spruce and upright of bearing , ceased to loll about on the tables or against the walls , and held themselves up .
She saw a look of real dislike cross Mrs Browning 's face , quickly followed by an expression of exasperation .
Murray 's face wore an expression of dismay and Richard realised that an explanation was needed immediately .
The young man had a mass of curly black hair , a reddish face and a frantic expression .
He managed to communicate to a certain extent through gestures and facial expressions , and he could put together short sentences .
Victor 's facial expression did n't change .
His facial expression never changed .
Obviously , the exact direction will depend on clues such as the speaker 's facial expression or tone of voice .
He made a wry face and shook his head , his eyes holding , at that moment , the same merry twinkle as his grandmother 's , a gaiety missing from his mother 's expression .
It was evident from his preoccupied expression and the abstracted way he ran his fingers through his thatch of silver hair that Gebrec had still not returned .
From her flustered expression and the fact that I was n't instantly told to mend my manners , I knew she felt guilty .
He assumed a pained expression and averted his eyes .
She looked down , a strangely pained expression on her face , then looked up again .
The stern , slightly pained expressions on the saints ' white and pink faces seemed to reflect fifty years or more of having a brass trumpet sounding in their ears .
Her puzzled expression was covered .
The Colonel was flung back against the wall where he stood , for a moment , a puzzled expression on his face .
Never pick the first fruit , " he said mysteriously , and then continued when he saw Patrick 's puzzled expression .
Johnny peered upwards , a puzzled expression on his face .
Alyssia gasped at his loose rendition of the truth , and then closed her mouth as she took in Piers 's frozen expression .
Mark 's face hardened into an expression of bitter hatred .
Ruxton was holding up a specimen of urine to the light and tossed the superintendent a friendly smile , while his secretary set her powdered face into an expression of restrained annoyance .
He bit off whatever he was going to say and inhaled deeply , smoothing his face into a blank expression so that only the hot glitter in his eyes betrayed his anger .
The rain was so heavy now that he was unable to see the expression on her face .
Nicholson remained slightly ahead of his group so that they could never quite see the expression of disdain of his face .
Make sure students can see your lips , and facial expression .
In the hotel lobby the manager , in black coat and striped trousers , stood with a pained expression frozen to his face as more policemen marched in .
The old gentleman looked at him with an expression of dislike .
Larry , my stepfather , sits stiffly with a pained expression on his face .
However , her expression of anger kept him in touch with that unrecognized part of himself , just as his control gave her a much needed boundary .
The expression on Mr Hibbert 's face did n't change .
The old man looked up , vaguely waving his teapot , an expression of simpering apprehension on his face .
She stood watching , quite unable to keep a hopeful expression off her face .
Her expression was grave , so very different from Sandy .
Katherine made a brief expression of annoyance ; this was the third time Lumley had requested fresh stock -- she would have to do something about it , and him .
I saw that the expression in his eyes was now one of slight amusement .
Gary 's expression became even more anxious .
The expression of pain in his face became something else entirely : in some part horror , in some part awe , but in the greatest part some sentiment for which she knew no word .
Gloria 's expression became pensive .
Travis 's expression became grim .
His expression grew cynical .
Her expression grew pensive .
